snippet: Lionel Messi scored a hat trick Thursday as Barcelona beat nine-man Rayo Vallecano, 5-1, to become the first Spanish club to play 35 consecutive matches without a loss, breaking a record Real Madrid set nearly three decades ago.
abstract: Barcelona defeats Vallecano, 5-1, becoming first Spanish soccer club to win 35 consecutive matches; other soccer matches noted.
lead_paragraph: Lionel Messi scored a hat trick Thursday as Barcelona beat nine-man Rayo Vallecano, 5-1, to become the first Spanish club to play 35 consecutive matches without a loss, breaking a record Real Madrid set nearly three decades ago.
